description.raw:
I'm not sure yet what caused it, but as reported on issue #2487, something broke manipulation in the model editor between 9.0.0 and 9.1.1. [Here](#!/osrf/gazebo/branches/compare/gazebo9_9.1.1%0Dgazebo9_9.0.0#chg-gazebo/rendering/Visual.cc)'s the diff between them if anyone wants to take a look. 

The reason for the failures is that model editor links also return true for the condition *If it is not a model and its parent is either a direct child or grandchild of the world, this is a light*. I'm not sure what changed or why it used to work, but the chart on pull request #1613 helps understand the visual tree a bit.

I've tested that the following manipulations work with this pull request:

* Lights in simulation
* Models in simulation
* Nested models in simulation (i.e. root model is manipulated)
* Links in the model editor
* Nested models in the model editor (i.e. top level nested model is manipulated)
description.html:
I'm not sure yet what caused it, but as reported on issue #2487, something broke manipulation in the model editor between 9.0.0 and 9.1.1. Here's the diff between them if anyone wants to take a look.

The reason for the failures is that model editor links also return true for the condition If it is not a model and its parent is either a direct child or grandchild of the world, this is a light. I'm not sure what changed or why it used to work, but the chart on pull request #1613 helps understand the visual tree a bit.

I've tested that the following manipulations work with this pull request:

  • Lights in simulation
  • Models in simulation
  • Nested models in simulation (i.e. root model is manipulated)
  • Links in the model editor
  • Nested models in the model editor (i.e. top level nested model is manipulated)

I'm not sure yet what caused it, but as reported on issue #2487, something broke manipulation in the model editor between 9.0.0 and 9.1.1. Here's the diff between them if anyone wants to take a look.

The reason for the failures is that model editor links also return true for the condition If it is not a model and its parent is either a direct child or grandchild of the world, this is a light. I'm not sure what changed or why it used to work, but the chart on pull request #1613 helps understand the visual tree a bit.

I've tested that the following manipulations work with this pull request:

  • Lights in simulation
  • Models in simulation
  • Nested models in simulation (i.e. root model is manipulated)
  • Links in the model editor
  • Nested models in the model editor (i.e. top level nested model is manipulated)
